intro: Tanacetopsis mucronata, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, yellowish-green composite flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its aromatic foliage. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Tanacetopsis mucronata is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
